physical_findings.name: Variable, depending on affected site
physical_findings.description: Physical findings will vary depending on the location of the tuberculosis infection.  For example, spinal tuberculosis might present with back pain and stiffness, while kidney tuberculosis could manifest with flank pain and hematuria.

TB blood test.abnormal_range: Positive result indicating presence of TB antibodies

TB skin test.abnormal_range: Positive result indicating presence of TB antibodies

Other lab tests.abnormal_range: Depending on the affected organ, other lab tests may reveal abnormalities (e.g., kidney function tests for kidney TB).

risk_factors: Close contact with someone with active TB
Living in areas with high TB prevalence

Chest X-ray.findings: May show abnormalities depending on the location of the TB (e.g., lung involvement)

CT scan.findings: Provides more detailed images of affected organs

MRI.findings: Useful for imaging the brain, spine, and other soft tissues

required: Positive TB test (blood or skin test)
Evidence of active TB infection (e.g., positive sputum culture, imaging findings)
supportive: Symptoms consistent with TB at the affected site
